titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 71 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 72 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الصَّادِقِ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمَا
titles.en: Chapter 70 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Abdullah Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> Bin Muhammad Al-Sadiq<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ الْإِشَارَةِ وَ النَّصِّ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 71 – The Indication and the wordings upon Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup>

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (329/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْقَلَّاءِ عَنِ الْفَيْضِ بْنِ الْمُخْتَارِ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) خُذْ بِيَدِي مِنَ النَّارِ مَنْ لَنَا بَعْدَكَ فَدَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ أَبُو إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ غُلَامٌ فَقَالَ هَذَا صَاحِبُكُمْ فَتَمَسَّكْ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Abdullah Al Qala’a, from Al Fayz Bin Al Mkhtar who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Take my hand out from the fire, who would be for us after you<sup>asws</sup>?’ So Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) came over to him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup>, in those days, was a boy. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This one<sup>asws</sup> is your master<sup>asws</sup>, therefore attach yourselves to him<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ahmad ibn Mihran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from ‘Abdallah al-Qalla’ from al-Fayd ibn al-Mukhtar who has said the following. “I said to abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.), ‘Please, take my hand out of fire. Who is for us after you (leave this world)?” Then abu Ibrahim (Musa ibn Ja‘far (a.s.) came and he was a young boy in those days. The Imam (a.s.) said, “This is your companion hold fast to him.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/330)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: صحيح - Sahih al-Kafi (36/ 1)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ ثُبَيْتٍ عَنْ مُعَاذِ بْنِ كَثِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لَهُ أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ الَّذِي رَزَقَ أَبَاكَ مِنْكَ هَذِهِ الْمَنْزِلَةَ أَنْ يَرْزُقَكَ مِنْ عَقِبِكَ قَبْلَ الْمَمَاتِ مِثْلَهَا فَقَالَ قَدْ فَعَلَ اللَّهُ ذَلِكَ قَالَ قُلْتُ مَنْ هُوَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَأَشَارَ إِلَى الْعَبْدِ الصَّالِحِ وَ هُوَ رَاقِدٌ فَقَالَ هَذَا الرَّاقِدُ وَ هُوَ غُلَامٌ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abu Ayoub Al Khazaz, from Sabeyt, from Muaz Bin Kaseer,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I ask Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Who Graced your<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> this status that He<sup>azwj</sup> should Grace you<sup>asws</sup> from your<sup>asws</sup> descendants, before your<sup>asws</sup> passing away, similar to it’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has already Done that’. I said, ‘Who is he<sup>asws</sup> (the next Imam<sup>asws</sup>)? May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>!’ So he<sup>asws</sup> gestured towards Al-Abd Al-Salih<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>), and he<sup>asws</sup> was lying (sleeping), and he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This one<sup>asws</sup> lying down’, and he<sup>asws</sup> was a boy’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people has narrated Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Thubayt from that Mu‘dh ibn Kathir who has said the following. “I said to abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.), ‘I pray to Allah who has granted your father because of you such a high position to grant you also such high position through your successor before you will leave this world.” He then said, “Allah has already granted such favor.” The narrator has said that he then asked the Imam (a.s.), “Who is he, ‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause?” He pointed out towards the pious servant (of Allah), who was asleep, saying this man who is asleep.” He was a young boy.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/330)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَرَّجَانِيُّ الْفَارِسِيُّ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ عَبْدَ الرَّحْمَنِ فِي السَّنَةِ الَّتِي أُخِذَ فِيهَا أَبُو الْحَسَنِ الْمَاضِي ( عليه السلام ) فَقُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ هَذَا الرَّجُلَ قَدْ صَارَ فِي يَدِ هَذَا وَ مَا نَدْرِي إِلَى مَا يَصِيرُ فَهَلْ بَلَغَكَ عَنْهُ فِي أَحَدٍ مِنْ وُلْدِهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ

فَقَالَ لِي مَا ظَنَنْتُ أَنَّ أَحَداً يَسْأَلُنِي عَنْ هَذِهِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ فَإِذَا هُوَ فِي بَيْتٍ كَذَا فِي دَارِهِ فِي مَسْجِدٍ لَهُ وَ هُوَ يَدْعُو وَ عَلَى يَمِينِهِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يُؤَمِّنُ عَلَى دُعَائِهِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جَعَلَنِيَ اللَّهُ فِدَاكَ قَدْ عَرَفْتَ انْقِطَاعِي إِلَيْكَ وَ خِدْمَتِي لَكَ فَمَنْ وَلِيُّ النَّاسِ بَعْدَكَ فَقَالَ إِنَّ مُوسَى قَدْ لَبِسَ الدِّرْعَ وَ سَاوَى عَلَيْهِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ لَا أَحْتَاجُ بَعْدَ هَذَا إِلَى شَيْ‏ءٍ .

en.hubeali: And by this chain, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad who said, ‘Abu Ali Al Arjany Al Farsy narrated to me, from Abdul Rahman Al Hajjaj who said,

‘I asked Abdul Rahman during the year in which Abu Al-Hassan Al-Maazy (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) was seized (imprisoned), and I said to him, ‘This man<sup>asws</sup> who has come to be in the hands of this one (the Caliph), and we do not know what would become of him<sup>asws</sup>. So has there reached anything from him<sup>asws</sup> regarding any one of his<sup>asws</sup> sons?’

So he said to me, ‘I had not thought anyone would be asking me about this issue. I had gone to Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> Bin Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> in his<sup>asws</sup> house, so there he<sup>asws</sup> was in a room of his<sup>asws</sup> house in a Masjid of his<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was supplicating, and upon his<sup>asws</sup> right hand was Musa<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, saying, ‘Ameen’, upon his<sup>asws</sup> supplication’. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Make me to be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! You<sup>asws</sup> have recognised my cutting-off (from others) to you<sup>asws</sup>, and my service to you<sup>asws</sup>. So who would be the Guardian of the people after you<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Musa<sup>asws</sup> had worn the armour and it fit evenly upon him<sup>asws</sup>’. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I am not needy after this, to anything’.
en.sarwar: 3. Through the same chain of narrators it is narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad who has said the following. “Abu Ali al-Arjani al-Farisi narrated to me from ‘Abd al-Rahman al- Hajjaj in the year ( 179 AH /795 AD) in which former abu al-Hasan, Imam Musa (a.s.) was detained. I (Hajjaj) said to him (‘Abd al-Rahman), “This man (abu al-Hassan Musa (a.s.) has been detained in his (Mansur, current ruler) hands. We do not know how his conditions are. Have you heard anything from him about his sons?” He (‘Abd al-Rahman) said to me, “I did not think anyone would ask me about this issue. Once I went to see Ja‘far ibn Muhammad (a.s.) in his home. He was in such and such a room at the prayer area. He was praying to Allah and on his right side was Musa ibn Ja‘far (a.s.) saying Amen for his prayer. I said to him, ‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, you know my having cutoff from all others to serve you, who will be the Wali Leader with Divine Authority for people after you?” He replied, “Musa has dressed up in this coat of arms and it has perfectly fitted him.” I then said to him, “I will not need anything after this.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/332)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ مُوسَى الصَّيْقَلِ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَدَخَلَ أَبُو إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ غُلَامٌ فَقَالَ اسْتَوْصِ بِهِ وَ ضَعْ أَمْرَهُ عِنْدَ مِنْ تَثِقُ بِهِ مِنْ أَصْحَابِكَ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Musa Al Sayqal, from Al Mufazzal Bin Umar who said,

‘I was in the presence of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) came over, and he<sup>asws</sup> was a boy. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> shall be bequeathing to him<sup>asws</sup>, and place his<sup>asws</sup> matter in the presence of the ones you can rely upon from your companions’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ahmad ibn Mihran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from Musa as.-Sayqal from al-Mufaddal ibn ‘Umar who has said the following. “Once I was in the presence of abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) that abu Ibrahim came and was a young boy. He (abu ‘Abdallah ) said (to me), “Accept my directive will about him (Musa ibn Ja‘far) and discuss his task (Leadership with Divine Authority) with your reliable companions.” :

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/332)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي يَوْماً فَسَأَلَهُ عَلِيُّ بْنُ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ فَقَالَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِلَى مَنْ نَفْزَعُ وَ يَفْزَعُ النَّاسُ بَعْدَكَ فَقَالَ إِلَى صَاحِبِ الثَّوْبَيْنِ الْأَصْفَرَيْنِ وَ الْغَدِيرَتَيْنِ يَعْنِي الذُّؤَابَتَيْنِ وَ هُوَ الطَّالِعُ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ هَذَا الْبَابِ يَفْتَحُ الْبَابَيْنِ بِيَدِهِ جَمِيعاً فَمَا لَبِثْنَا أَنْ طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْنَا كَفَّانِ آخِذَةً بِالْبَابَيْنِ فَفَتَحَهُمَا ثُمَّ دَخَلَ عَلَيْنَا أَبُو إِبْرَاهِيمَ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Yaqoub Bin Ja’far Al Ja’fary who said,

‘Is’haq son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> narrated to me saying, ‘I was in the presence of my father<sup>asws</sup> one day, so Ali Bin Umar Bin Ali asked him<sup>asws</sup> saying, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! To who should we turn to (when in distress), and the people in desperate need, after you<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘To the owner of the two yellow clothes, and the two streams, meaning the two tresses (of hair), and he<sup>asws</sup> would be emerging to you from this door’. He<sup>asws</sup> opened the two doors together. So we did not wait long before there emerged to us two palms grabbing the two doors, and opened them. Then Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) entered coming towards us’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ahmad ibn Mihran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from Ya‘qub ibn Ja‘far al-Ja‘fari who has said that Ishaq ibn Ja‘far (a.s.) said to me the following. “One day I was in the presence of my father that Ali ibn ‘Umar ibn Ali asked him this question. “‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, “from who should we seek help and the people seek help and assistance after you (leave this world)?” He (The Imam (a.s.) said, you must seek refuge and guidance from the man who has two yellow clothes on him and a twine bunch of hair who will shortly appear to you from this door, opening the both halves of the door with his hand together.” We did not wait very long that there appeared two palms holding both halves of the door and opened them. Thereafter came to us abu Ibrahim (a.s.).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/333)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ الْجَمَّالِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ لَهُ مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ بِأَبِي أَنْتَ وَ أُمِّي إِنَّ الْأَنْفُسَ يُغْدَى عَلَيْهَا وَ يُرَاحُ فَإِذَا كَانَ ذَلِكَ فَمَنْ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا كَانَ ذَلِكَ فَهُوَ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَ ضَرَبَ بِيَدِهِ عَلَى مَنْكِبِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) الْأَيْمَنِ فِي مَا أَعْلَمُ وَ هُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ خُمَاسِيٌّ وَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ جَالِسٌ مَعَنَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Najran, from Safwan Al Jammal,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘Mansour Bin Hazim said to him<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>, ‘May by father and my mother be (sacrificed) for you<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>! The souls (people) wake up in the morning and they leave (die). So when it was that, so who (would be the next Imam<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>)?’ So Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘When it would be like that, so it would be your master<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’, and he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> struck by his<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> hand upon a shoulder of Abu Al-Hassan<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> (7<sup style="font-weight: normal">th</sup> Imam<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>), the right one as far as I know, and he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>, in those days, was five, and Abdullah, son of Ja’far<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> was seated along with us’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu Najran from Safwan al-Jammal from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.). Safwan has said the following. “Mansur ibn Hazim said to him, ‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, the (human) souls pass through mornings and evenings if that (death for you) comes then who (will be the Imam)?” Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) then said, “If that happens then he is your companion.” He tapped the right shoulder of abu al-Hassan with his hand, as I know. He was five (feet tall or years old) at that time and ‘Abdallah ibn Ja‘far was also present with us.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/333)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

parts.text: عِيسَى بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنْ كَانَ كَوْنٌ وَ لَا أَرَانِي اللَّهُ ذَلِكَ فَبِمَنْ أَئْتَمُّ قَالَ فَأَوْمَأَ إِلَى ابْنِهِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام )
قُلْتُ فَإِنْ حَدَثَ بِمُوسَى حَدَثٌ فَبِمَنْ أَئْتَمُّ قَالَ بِوَلَدِهِ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ حَدَثَ بِوَلَدِهِ حَدَثٌ وَ تَرَكَ أَخاً كَبِيراً وَ ابْناً صَغِيراً فَبِمَنْ أَئْتَمُّ قَالَ بِوَلَدِهِ
ثُمَّ قَالَ هَكَذَا أَبَداً قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ أَعْرِفْهُ وَ لَا أَعْرِفْ مَوْضِعَهُ قَالَ تَقُولُ
اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَتَوَلَّى مَنْ بَقِيَ مِنْ حُجَجِكَ مِنْ وُلْدِ الْإِمَامِ الْمَاضِي فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ يُجْزِيكَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Abdul Rahman Bin Abu Najran,

(It has been narrated) from Isa Bin Abdullah Bin Muhammad Bin Umar, son of Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Abu Talib<sup>asws</sup>, from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘If it does happen, and may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> not Show me that, so with one should I take as an Imam<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> gestured towards his<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup> Musa<sup>asws</sup>’.

I said, ‘So if It occurs with Musa<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> an occurrence (of death), so with whom should I take as an Imam<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>?’ He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘With his<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> son<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’. I said, ‘Supposing there occurs with his<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> son<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> an occurrence (of death), and he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> leaves a lot of brothers and young sons, so with whom should I take as an Imam<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>?’ He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘With his<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> son<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’.

Then he<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘This is how it will be for ever!’. I said, ‘Supposing I do not reconise him<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> nor do I recognise his<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> place?’ He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘You should be saying,

‘O Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>! I hereby take as a Guardian the one<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> who remains from Your<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Divine Authority, from a son<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> of the past Imam<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’. So that would suffice you, if Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> so Desires’.
en.sarwar: 7. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn abu Najran from ‘Isa ibn ‘Abdallah ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Umar ibn Ali ibn abu Talib (a.s.) who has said the following. “I said to abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.). “If something would happen (death of Imam), may Allah will not make me experience it, then who must I follow as my Imam?” The narrator has said that he pointed to his son Musa (a.s.). I then asked, “What if something will happen to Musa (a.s.) then who must I follow as my Imam?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “Follow his sons. Then he said, “In this way for ever.” I then asked, “What if I will not know him and will not know his place?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “Say, ‘O Lord, I love and take as my guardian whoever is left (on earth) as your authority of the sons of the preceding Imam. This will be enough for you if Allah would so will.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/334)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْقَلَّاءِ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ

text: ذَكَرَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ يَوْمَئِذٍ غُلَامٌ فَقَالَ هَذَا الْمَوْلُودُ الَّذِي لَمْ يُولَدْ فِينَا مَوْلُودٌ أَعْظَمُ بَرَكَةً عَلَى شِيعَتِنَا مِنْهُ
ثُمَّ قَالَ لِي لَا تَجْفُوا إِسْمَاعِيلَ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Ali, from Abdullah Al Qala’a, from Al Mufazzal Bin Umar who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> mentioned Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup>, in those days, was a boy. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This ‘الْمَوْلُودُ’ (coming to world) is which there has not been born among us<sup>asws</sup> a ‘مَوْلُودٌ’ greater of Blessings upon our<sup>asws</sup> Shias than him<sup>asws</sup>’.
Then he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Do not ignore Ismail’.
en.sarwar: 8. Ahmad ibn Mihran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from ‘Abdallah al-Qalla’ from al-Mufaddal ibn ‘Umar who has said the following. “Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) spoke of abu al-Hassan (a.s.) and he was a young boy in those days. He said, “This is a child that no other child born to us has been of such a greater blessing to our followers than him.” The Imam (a.s.) then said to me, “Do not be harsh with Isma‘il.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/334)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى وَ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ فَيْضِ بْنِ الْمُخْتَارِ فِي

text: حَدِيثٍ طَوِيلٍ فِي أَمْرِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) حَتَّى قَالَ لَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) هُوَ صَاحِبُكَ الَّذِي سَأَلْتَ عَنْهُ فَقُمْ إِلَيْهِ فَأَقِرَّ لَهُ بِحَقِّهِ فَقُمْتُ حَتَّى قَبَّلْتُ رَأْسَهُ وَ يَدَهُ وَ دَعَوْتُ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَهُ

فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَمَا إِنَّهُ لَمْ يُؤْذَنْ لَنَا فِي أَوَّلَ مِنْكَ قَالَ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَأُخْبِرُ بِهِ أَحَداً فَقَالَ نَعَمْ أَهْلَكَ وَ وُلْدَكَ وَ كَانَ مَعِي أَهْلِي وَ وُلْدِي وَ رُفَقَائِي وَ كَانَ يُونُسُ بْنُ ظَبْيَانَ مِنْ رُفَقَائِي فَلَمَّا أَخْبَرْتُهُمْ حَمِدُوا اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ قَالَ يُونُسُ لَا وَ اللَّهِ حَتَّى أَسْمَعَ ذَلِكَ مِنْهُ وَ كَانَتْ بِهِ عَجَلَةٌ فَخَرَجَ فَاتَّبَعْتُهُ

فَلَمَّا انْتَهَيْتُ إِلَى الْبَابِ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَهُ وَ قَدْ سَبَقَنِي إِلَيْهِ يَا يُونُسُ الْأَمْرُ كَمَا قَالَ لَكَ فَيْضٌ قَالَ فَقَالَ سَمِعْتُ وَ أَطَعْتُ فَقَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) خُذْهُ إِلَيْكَ يَا فَيْضُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya and Ahmad Bin Idrees, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Al Hassan Bin Al Husayn, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Al Maysami, from Fayz Bin Al Mukhtar,

‘In a lengthy Hadeeth regarding the command of Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, until Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘He<sup>asws</sup> is your Master<sup>asws</sup> whom you asked about, therefore stand and go to him<sup>asws</sup> and acknowledge to him<sup>asws</sup> of his<sup>asws</sup> right’. So I stood until I kissed his<sup>asws</sup> head and his<sup>asws</sup> hand, and I supplicated to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic for him<sup>asws</sup>.

So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But, it was not Permitted for us<sup>asws</sup> at first before you’. I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! So, should I inform anyone (else) with it?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, your wife and your children’. And it was so that with me was my wife and children and my friends, and it was so that Yunus Bin Zibyan was from my friends. So when I informed them, they Praised Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic and Yunus said, ‘No, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, until I hear that from him<sup>asws</sup>’, and there was a haste with him. So he went out, and I followed him.

So when I ended up to the door, I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying to him: ‘And you have preceded me<sup>asws</sup> to it, O Yunus. The matter is as Fayz has said to you’. So he said, ‘I have heard, and I shall obey’. So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Take him with you, O Fayz’.
en.sarwar: 9. Muhammad ibn Yahya and Ahmad ibn Idris have narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from al-Hassan ibn al-Husayn from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan al-Maythami from Fayd ibn al-Mukhtar, in a lengthy hadith on the affair of abu al-Hassan (a.s.). In it abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) has said to the narrator. “He is your Master of who you asked. Stand up for him and acknowledge his rights.” I then stood up and kissed his head and hand and prayed to Allah, the Most Holy, the Most High, for him.” Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) then said, “Keep in mind that permission is not given to us to speak about him to anyone before you.” The narrator has said that he then said to the Imam (a.s.), “‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, can I inform any one about him?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “Yes, you may inform your family (wife) and sons.” With me there were my family (wife), sons and friends and of my friends there was Yunus ibn al_Zabyan. When I informed them they all thanked Allah, the Most Holy, the Most High. Yunus said, “No, by Allah, I must hear that from him. He was in a hurry. He went and I followed him. When I reached the door I heard abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) say to him,- he had reached him before I-, “What Fayd has said to you is true.” The narrator has said that he (Yunus) then said, “I have heard it and I have obeyed.” Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) then said, “Take him with you, O Fayd.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول أو حسن كما مر - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/336)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ فُضَيْلٍ عَنْ طَاهِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَلُومُ عَبْدَ اللَّهِ وَ يُعَاتِبُهُ وَ يَعِظُهُ وَ يَقُولُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مِثْلَ أَخِيكَ فَوَ اللَّهِ إِنِّي لَأَعْرِفُ النُّورَ فِي وَجْهِهِ فَقَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ لِمَ أَ لَيْسَ أَبِي وَ أَبُوهُ وَاحِداً وَ أُمِّي وَ أُمُّهُ وَاحِدَةً فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ إِنَّهُ مِنْ نَفْسِي وَ أَنْتَ ابْنِي .

en.hubeali: Muhammad BinYahya, from Muhammad Bin Al-Husayn, from Ja’far Bin Bashir, from Fuzayl, from Tahir,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘It was so that Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> was blaming Abdullah, and admonishing him and exhorting him, and he<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘What is preventing you from becoming like your brother (Musa<sup>asws</sup>), for, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, I<sup>asws</sup> recognise the Light in his<sup>asws</sup> face’. So Abdullah said, ‘Isn’t my father<sup>asws</sup> and his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> one, and my mother and his<sup>asws</sup> mother one?’ So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘He<sup>asws</sup> is from my<sup>asws</sup> self, and you are my<sup>asws</sup> son’.
en.sarwar: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Ja‘far ibn Bashir from Fudayl from Tahir from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.). He has said that abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) would blame ‘Abdallah, show him his anger and advise him saying, “What is the matter that you are not like your brother (Musa) By Allah, I observe light inhis face.” ‘Abdallah thensaid, “Why is it? Is my and his father and mother not the same?” Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) then said, “He from my soul and you are my son.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/336)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ السَّرَّاجِ قَالَ

text: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ وَاقِفٌ عَلَى رَأْسِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى وَ هُوَ فِي الْمَهْدِ فَجَعَلَ يُسَارُّهُ طَوِيلًا فَجَلَسْتُ حَتَّى فَرَغَ فَقُمْتُ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لِي ادْنُ مِنْ مَوْلَاكَ فَسَلِّمْ فَدَنَوْتُ فَسَلَّمْتُ عَلَيْهِ فَرَدَّ عَلَيَّ السَّلَامَ بِلِسَانٍ فَصِيحٍ

ثُمَّ قَالَ لِيَ اذْهَبْ فَغَيِّرِ اسْمَ ابْنَتِكَ الَّتِي سَمَّيْتَهَا أَمْسِ فَإِنَّهُ اسْمٌ يُبْغِضُهُ اللَّهُ وَ كَانَ وُلِدَتْ لِيَ ابْنَةٌ سَمَّيْتُهَا بِالْحُمَيْرَاءِ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) انْتَهِ إِلَى أَمْرِهِ تُرْشَدْ فَغَيَّرْتُ اسْمَهَا .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Washha, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Yaqoub Al Sarraj who said,

‘I went over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> had paused by the head of Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was in the cradle. So he<sup>asws</sup> went on to talk secretively to him<sup>asws</sup> for a long time. So I sat down until he<sup>asws</sup> was free. Then I stood up to (speak with) him<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Approach your Master<sup>asws</sup>, and greet’. So I approached and greeted upon him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> returned the greeting by an eloquent tongue.

Then he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Go, and change the name of your daughter which you named her with yesterday, for it is a name Hated by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’. And it was so that a daughter had been born unto me. I had named her as Al-Humeyra. So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Finalise this matter, you would be rightly Guided’. So I changed her name’.
en.sarwar: 11. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad from al-Washsha’ from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Ya‘qub al-Sarraj who has said the following. “Once I went to see abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who was standing by the cradle of abu al-Hassan. He began to speak secretly to him for a long time. I sat there until he was free. I then stood for him and he said to me, “Come close to your Mawla (master and Leader with Divine Authority).” I went close and said greetings. He answered my greetings very clearly and then he said to me, “Go and change the name of your daughter that you named just yesterday. It is a name makes Allah angry.” A girl was born to us and I had named her al-Humayra’.” Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) said to me, “Follow his command you will have the right guidance.” I then changed her name.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/337)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: صحيح - Sahih al-Kafi (1/36)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ قَالَ

text: دَعَا أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَوْماً وَ نَحْنُ عِنْدَهُ فَقَالَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُمْ بِهَذَا فَهُوَ وَ اللَّهِ صَاحِبُكُمْ بَعْدِي .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Idrees, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Ibn Muskan, from Suleyman Bin Khalid who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> called Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> one day, and we were in his<sup>asws</sup> presence, so he<sup>asws</sup> said to us: ‘It is upon you all with this one<sup>asws</sup>, for he<sup>asws</sup>, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, is your Master<sup>asws</sup> after me<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 12. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from ibn Muskan from Sulayman ibn Khalid who has said the following. “Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) one day called abu al-Hassan (a.s.) while we were in his presence and said to us, “You must take hold of this man. He, by Allah, will be your Master after me.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (337/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ زُرْبِيٍّ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ النَّحْوِيِّ قَالَ

text: بَعَثَ إِلَيَّ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ الْمَنْصُورُ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ فَأَتَيْتُهُ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَ هُوَ جَالِسٌ عَلَى كُرْسِيٍّ وَ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ شَمْعَةٌ وَ فِي يَدِهِ كِتَابٌ قَالَ فَلَمَّا سَلَّمْتُ عَلَيْهِ رَمَى بِالْكِتَابِ إِلَيَّ وَ هُوَ يَبْكِي فَقَالَ لِي هَذَا كِتَابُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ يُخْبِرُنَا أَنَّ جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ قَدْ مَاتَ فَإِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَ إِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُونَ ثَلَاثاً وَ أَيْنَ مِثْلُ جَعْفَرٍ

ثُمَّ قَالَ لِيَ اكْتُبْ قَالَ فَكَتَبْتُ صَدْرَ الْكِتَابِ ثُمَّ قَالَ اكْتُبْ إِنْ كَانَ أَوْصَى إِلَى رَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ بِعَيْنِهِ فَقَدِّمْهُ وَ اضْرِبْ عُنُقَهُ قَالَ فَرَجَعَ إِلَيْهِ الْجَوَابُ أَنَّهُ قَدْ أَوْصَى إِلَى خَمْسَةٍ وَاحِدُهُمْ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ الْمَنْصُورُ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ وَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ وَ مُوسَى وَ حَمِيدَةُ.

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from Sahl, or someone else, from Muhammad Bin Al Waleed, from Yunus, from Dawood Zurby, from Abu Ayoub Al Nahwa who said,

‘Abu Ja’far Al-Manour (the Caliph) sent for me in the middle of the night. So I went over to him and came up to him, and he was seated upon a chair, and in front of him was a candle and in his hand was a letter. So when I greeted upon him, he threw the letter towards me and he was crying, and he said to me, ‘This is the letter of Muhammad Bin Suleyman informing us that Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> Bin Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> has passed away, for we are for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and to Him<sup>azwj</sup> are we returning (three times), and where is the likes of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>?’

Then he said to me, ‘Write!’ So I wrote the commencement of the letter. Then he said, ‘If it was so that he<sup>asws</sup> had bequeathed to one man in particular, so bring him forward and strike off his neck’. So the answer returned to him that he<sup>asws</sup> had bequeathed to five – Abu Ja’far Al-Mansour, and Muhammad Bin Suleyman, and Abdullah, and Musa<sup>asws</sup>, and Hameyda’.
en.sarwar: 13. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Sahl or an other person, from Muhammad ibn al-Walid from Yunus from Dawud ibn Zurbi from abu Ayyub al-Nahwi who has said the following. “Abu Ja‘far, al-Mansur summoned me in the middle of the night and I went to see him. When met him he was sitting in a chair. Before him there was a candle and a letter in his hand. The narrator has said that I greeted him and he threw the letter to me while was weeping. He said, “This is a letter of Muhammad ibn Sulayman in which he has informed us that abu Ja‘far ibn Muhammad (a.s.) has died. We are for Allah and to Him we will all return. He said it three times. Where is anyone like Ja‘far? “ Then he said to me, “Write down.” The narrator has said that I then wrote. I wrote the introduction of the letter. He (Mansur) said, “Write to ask if he has left a directive will to any man particularly, if so summon him and kill him.” He has said that reply to hisletter came back that said the Imam (a.s.) has in fact, left a will to five people and one of them is abu Ja‘far al-Mansur, Muhammad ibn Sulayman, ‘Abdallah, Musa and Hamida.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: إما مرسل أو مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (338/ 3)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

parts.text: النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ بِنَحْوٍ مِنْ هَذَا إِلَّا

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ بِنَحْوٍ مِنْ هَذَا إِلَّا أَنَّ

text: هُ ذَكَرَ أَنَّهُ أَوْصَى إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الْمَنْصُورِ وَ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ وَ مُوسَى وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ وَ مَوْلًى لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ  ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ فَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ لَيْسَ إِلَى قَتْلِ هَؤُلَاءِ سَبِيلٌ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd,

‘Approximate to this (above Hadeeth), except that he (the narrator) mentioned that he<sup>asws</sup> had bequeathed to Abu Ja’far Mansour, and Abdullah, and Musa<sup>asws</sup>, and Muhammad Bin Ja’far, and a slave of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>. So Abu Ja’far (the Caliph) said, ‘There isn’t a way to kill them (all)’.
en.sarwar: 14. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from al-Nadr ibn Suwayd has narrated a similar hadith as the above except that he has said, “He left a will to abu Ja‘far, al-Mansur, ‘Abdallah , Musa, Muhammad ibn Ja‘far and Mawla of abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.). Abu Ja‘far then said, “There is no way to kill these people.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/338)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ الْجَمَّالِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ صَاحِبِ هَذَا الْأَمْرِ فَقَالَ إِنَّ صَاحِبَ هَذَا الْأَمْرِ لَا يَلْهُو وَ لَا يَلْعَبُ وَ أَقْبَلَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى وَ هُوَ صَغِيرٌ وَ مَعَهُ عَنَاقٌ مَكِّيَّةٌ وَ هُوَ يَقُولُ لَهَا اسْجُدِي لِرَبِّكِ فَأَخَذَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ ضَمَّهُ إِلَيْهِ وَ قَالَ بِأَبِي وَ أُمِّي مَنْ لَا يَلْهُو وَ لَا يَلْعَبُ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Washha, from Ali Bin Al Hassan, from Safwan Al Jammal who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the Master of this command (Imamate), so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The Master of this command would ‘لَا يَلْهُو وَ لَا يَلْعَبُ’ neither (indulge in) games nor play’, and Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> came over, and he<sup>asws</sup> was young, and with him<sup>asws</sup> was a Meccan kid (baby goat), and he<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Prostrate to your Lord<sup>azwj</sup>!’ So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> grabbed him<sup>asws</sup> and embraced him<sup>asws</sup> to himself<sup>asws</sup> and said: ‘By my<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> and my<sup>asws</sup> mother! The one<sup>asws</sup> who neither (indulges in) games nor play’.
en.sarwar: 15. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad from al-Washsha’ from Ali ibn al-Hassan from Safwan al-Jammal who has said the following. “I asked abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) about the in charge of this matter (Leadership with Divine Authority) nad he said. “ The in charge of the task does not trifle or play. At this time abu al-Hassan, Musa came. He was very small. With him there was a baby goat of Makka and he was saying to her, “Prostrate before your Lord. Abu ‘Abdallah then took him and hugged him and said, “May Allah take my soul and the souls of my parents in service for the cause of one who does not trifle and engage in amusement.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/339)
Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi: ضعيف - Sahih al-Kafi

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ عُبَيْسِ بْنِ هِشَامٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي عُمَرُ الرُّمَّانِيُّ عَنْ فَيْضِ بْنِ الْمُخْتَارِ قَالَ

text: إِنِّي لَعِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذْ أَقْبَلَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ غُلَامٌ فَالْتَزَمْتُهُ وَ قَبَّلْتُهُ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنْتُمُ السَّفِينَةُ وَ هَذَا مَلَّاحُهَا

قَالَ فَحَجَجْتُ مِنْ قَابِلٍ وَ مَعِي أَلْفَا دِينَارٍ فَبَعَثْتُ بِأَلْفٍ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَلْفٍ إِلَيْهِ فَلَمَّا دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ يَا فَيْضُ عَدَلْتَهُ بِي قُلْتُ إِنَّمَا فَعَلْتُ ذَلِكَ لِقَوْلِكَ فَقَالَ أَمَا وَ اللَّهِ مَا أَنَا فَعَلْتُ ذَلِكَ بَلِ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَعَلَهُ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from one of our companions, from Ubeys Bin Hisham who said, ‘Umro Al Rummany narrated to me, from Fayz Bin Al Mukhtar who said,

‘I was in the presence of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> when Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> came over, and he<sup>asws</sup> was a boy. So he<sup>asws</sup> embraced him<sup>asws</sup> and kissed him<sup>asws</sup>, and Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You are the ship and this one<sup>asws</sup> is its captain’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘So I performed Hajj the next year and with me were two thousand Dinars. So I sent a thousand over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> and a thousand to him<sup>asws</sup> (Musa<sup>asws</sup>). So when I went over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Fayz! You equated him<sup>asws</sup> with me<sup>asws</sup>’. I said, ‘But rather, I did that due to your<sup>asws</sup> words’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, it was not I<sup>asws</sup> who did that, but (it was) Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic who Did it with him<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 16. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from one of our people from ‘Ubays ibn Hisham that ‘Umar al-Rummaniy narrated to from Fayd ibn al-Mukhtar the following. “Once when I was in the presence of abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) that abu al-Hassan Musa (a.s.) came and he was a young boy. I held and kissed him. Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) said, “You are the ark and he is the captain.” The narrator has said that he wen to perform Hajj next year and I had two thousand Dinars. I sent one thousand toabu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) and one thousand to him (abu al-Hassan). When went to see abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) he said, “You have considered him equal to me.” I said, “I did so because of your words.” He then said, “I swear by Allah, I did not do so, in fact, Allah, the Most Holy, the Most High, has done it for him (abu al-Hassan Musa (a.s.).”
